pathTokens: D: Keene Valley and Chapel Pond

content.description:
This is a small, 70'-high, southeast-facing cliff is a better-known for its sport climbs (The Honey Pot), but it has one really good ice route. 

  The cliff is about 80' wide, and has a low, sheer, vertical wall, a roof at mid-height, and an overhanging wall at the top. It is nestled in a tiny valley, and sees full sun until mid afternoon. The base of the cliff is open and pleasant, and there are decent views of the valley from the top. The Northway can be seen (and barely heard) from the top.
